reason: NO_RULE - insufficient evidence or no valid constraint found
notes: The evidence provided only describes the behavior of the firstActiveDownlinkBWP-Id within its own IE and does not establish any inter-IE relationship with the bwp-id field from the pdsch-config_tci-statestoaddmodlist IE.

meta.evidence: If configured for an SCell, this field contains the ID of the downlink bandwidth part to be used upon activation of an SCell. The initial bandwidth part is referred to by BWP-Id = 0. \\ Upon reconfiguration with reconfigurationWithSync, the network sets the firstActiveDownlinkBWP-Id and firstActiveUplinkBWP-Id to the same value.

full_api_response.notes: The evidence provided only describes the behavior of the firstActiveDownlinkBWP-Id within its own IE and does not establish any inter-IE relationship with the bwp-id field from the pdsch-config_tci-statestoaddmodlist IE.
